qas.question: What enzymes are used to produce H2?

answers.text: in the transfer of reducing equivalents produced during pyruvate fermentation to water

qas.question: What is the natural cycle of hydrogen production and consumption by organisms called?

context: H2 is a product of some types of anaerobic metabolism and is produced by several microorganisms, usually via reactions catalyzed by iron- or nickel-containing enzymes called <a0_0>hydrogenases<a0_0/>. These enzymes catalyze the reversible redox reaction between H2 and its component two protons and two electrons. Creation of hydrogen gas occurs <a1_0>in the transfer of reducing equivalents produced during pyruvate fermentation to water<a1_0/>. The natural cycle of hydrogen production and consumption by organisms is called the <a2_0>hydrogen cycle<a2_0/>.
